question: Paging

options.A: is a method of memory allocation by which the program is subdivided into equal portions, or pages and core is subdivided into equal portions or blocks.
options.B: consists of those addresses that may be generated by a processor during execution of a computation.
options.C: is a method of allocating processor time.
options.D: allows multiple programs to reside in separate areas of core at the time.

question: Round-robin scheduling

options.C: gives each task the same chance at the processor
options.D: allows processor-bound tasks more time in the processor
